page.title: 15INDUSTRY GEORGE FISCHER
page.content: There are 350 people work at George Fischer,290 on the shop floor and 60 in the office and as supervisors. George Fischer make castings for motors,ferrous ans non-ferrous. For ferrous castings they use scrap metal,limestone and carbon.For non-ferrous castings they use aluminium. The company has been George Fischer for five years,before that it wasLeys Malleable Castings since 1948.In 1918 it was a jam factory and then Harrisons,who were iron makers on the Brayford in Lincoln,moved there.The products have remained similar since then,except during the war when they made parts for tanks. The castings are sent all over the British Isles and Continent.They work 20hours a day in shifts.
